result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Terrell Weston Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days TIME SERVED.  Court ordered the Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments to be paid on or before 03-24-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

COURT ORDERED 30 hours of community service on or before 03-24-2015.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of the Court's order with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
No reply from defendant or surety.  vp

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  No Assistant District Attorney for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for a plea/sentencing hearing. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony Terrell Weston not in court.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
